meanings.def: a length of time in the life of a particular person or in the history of a particular country
examples: Which period of history would you most like to have lived in?
This textbook covers the post-war period.
The church dates from the Norman period.
We are currently studying the early medieval period.
Like Picasso, she too had a blue period.
Most teenagers go through a period of rebelling.
The picture was painted by Picasso during his blue period.
the late Victorian period
the period covered by the book
a dark period in the country's history

meanings.def: a length of time which is a division of an era. A period is divided into epochs.
examples: the Jurassic period
Dinosaurs died out during the Cretaceous period.

meanings.def: any of the parts that a day is divided into at a school, college, etc. for study
examples: ‘What do you have next period?’ ‘French.’
a free/study period (= for private study)
We've got French next period.
I have two free periods on Tuesday afternoons.

meanings.def: the flow of blood each month from the body of a woman who is not pregnant
examples: period pains
monthly periods
When did you last have a period?
I was thirteen when I started my period.
I have my period and don't feel too great.
Missing a period is often one of the first signs that a woman is pregnant.

meanings.def: the mark ( . ) used at the end of a sentence and in some abbreviations, for example e.g.
used at the end of a sentence to emphasize that there is nothing more to say about a subject
examples: The answer is no, period!

meanings.def: having a style typical of a particular time in history
examples: period costumes/furniture
